0: Pakistan's military nabbed an al Qaeda operative in the port city of Karachi in the country's first arrest of a militant since the killing of Osama bin Laden on its soil by U.S. forces. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Pakistan made the arrest on its own, but the U.S. provided intelligence that helped lead to the detention of Muhammad Ali Qasim Yaqub, Pakistani officials said. Mr. Yaqub is a Yemeni citizen who U.S. officials described as a "midlevel" al Qaeda operative.
